tasks.title: Set Up Development Environment
tasks.description: Initialize the development environment with necessary tools, libraries, and testing frameworks.
tasks.details: Install Node.js, Python, and necessary libraries such as React, Material UI, Express.js, FastAPI, networkx, and shapely. Set up a version control system using Git. Additionally, install and configure pytest for Python backend testing and Jest with React Testing Library for React frontend testing. Set up test configuration files for both frameworks.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify installation by running a simple React app and a Python script. Ensure pytest and Jest are properly configured by running sample tests for both the backend and frontend.

subtasks.title: Install Node.js and Python
subtasks.description: Install the latest versions of Node.js and Python.
subtasks.details: Use package managers like nvm for Node.js and pyenv for Python.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'node -v' and 'python --version' to verify installations.

subtasks.title: Set Up Version Control
subtasks.description: Initialize a Git repository for the project.
subtasks.details: Create a new repository on GitHub and clone it locally.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify by committing a README file.

subtasks.title: Install Frontend Libraries
subtasks.description: Install React and Material UI.
subtasks.details: Use npm to install React and Material UI.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create a simple React component to verify installation.

subtasks.title: Install Backend Libraries
subtasks.description: Install Express.js, FastAPI, networkx, and shapely.
subtasks.details: Use npm for Express.js and pip for Python libraries.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run a basic Express server and a Python script using FastAPI.

subtasks.title: Set Up Testing Frameworks
subtasks.description: Install and configure pytest and Jest with React Testing Library.
subtasks.details: Use pip to install pytest and npm for Jest and React Testing Library. Create configuration files for both frameworks.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run sample tests to ensure both frameworks are correctly configured.

tasks.title: Create Sample Test Data
tasks.description: Develop sample blueprint images and wall-line JSON files for testing.
tasks.details: Create a set of JSON files representing wall line segments and corresponding PNG/JPG images for visual reference. Ensure data covers various room configurations.
tasks.testStrategy: Manually verify that JSON data accurately represents the visual blueprint images.

subtasks.title: Create Simple Floorplan JSON
subtasks.description: Develop a JSON file for a simple room configuration.
subtasks.details: Design a JSON structure to represent basic wall line segments for a simple room. Ensure the format is consistent with project standards.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify JSON structure against a predefined schema.

subtasks.title: Create Complex Floorplan JSON
subtasks.description: Develop a JSON file for a complex room configuration.
subtasks.details: Design a JSON structure to represent complex wall line segments, including multiple rooms and corridors. Ensure the format is consistent with project standards.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify JSON structure against a predefined schema and test with edge cases.

subtasks.title: Generate Corresponding Blueprint Images
subtasks.description: Create PNG/JPG images for the JSON floorplans.
subtasks.details: Use graphic design tools to create visual representations of the simple and complex floorplans. Ensure images match the JSON data accurately.
subtasks.testStrategy: Manually compare images with JSON data to ensure accuracy.

subtasks.title: Organize Test Data Structure
subtasks.description: Organize JSON files and images into a structured directory.
subtasks.details: Create a directory structure to store JSON files and images. Ensure easy access and retrieval for testing purposes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all files are correctly named and stored in the appropriate directories.

subtasks.title: Document Test Cases for Sample Data
subtasks.description: Write documentation for testing the sample data.
subtasks.details: Create a document outlining test cases for verifying the accuracy of JSON and image data. Include steps for manual verification and expected outcomes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review documentation for completeness and clarity.

tasks.title: Implement Core Algorithm: Parse Line Segments
tasks.description: Develop functionality to parse line segments from JSON input.
tasks.details: Use Python to read JSON input and extract line segment data. Ensure data is structured for further processing. Implement robust error handling for invalid JSON and edge cases.
tasks.testStrategy: Create pytest unit tests to cover valid JSON parsing, invalid JSON handling, edge cases (empty arrays, malformed data), and verify correct data structure output. Include at least 5-7 test cases to ensure comprehensive coverage of the parsing logic.

subtasks.title: Write unit test for valid JSON parsing
subtasks.description: Ensure that valid JSON input is correctly parsed into line segment data structures.
subtasks.details: Use pytest to write a test case that checks the parsing of a well-formed JSON input.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the parsed output matches the expected data structure.

subtasks.title: Write unit test for invalid JSON handling
subtasks.description: Test the parser's response to invalid JSON input.
subtasks.details: Use pytest to write a test case that checks how the parser handles malformed JSON.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure that appropriate exceptions are raised for invalid JSON.

subtasks.title: Write unit test for edge cases
subtasks.description: Test the parser with edge cases such as empty arrays and malformed data.
subtasks.details: Use pytest to write test cases for edge scenarios.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the parser handles edge cases gracefully without crashing.

subtasks.title: Verify correct data structure output
subtasks.description: Ensure that the parsed data is structured correctly for further processing.
subtasks.details: Use pytest to write test cases that validate the structure of the parsed data.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that the output data structure matches the expected format.

subtasks.title: Create Python Module Structure
subtasks.description: Set up the Python module structure for the line segment parser
subtasks.details: Create a new Python module file (e.g., `parser.py`) with proper structure and imports. Set up the basic function skeleton for parsing line segments.

subtasks.title: Implement JSON Parsing Function
subtasks.description: Implement the core function to parse JSON and extract line segment data
subtasks.details: Write a function that reads JSON input, validates the structure, and extracts line segment data (start, end coordinates, type, is_load_bearing).

subtasks.title: Implement Data Validation
subtasks.description: Add validation for line segment data structure
subtasks.details: Validate that each line segment has required fields (type, start, end) and that coordinates are valid numbers within expected ranges.

subtasks.title: Implement Error Handling
subtasks.description: Add robust error handling for invalid JSON and edge cases
subtasks.details: Handle cases like malformed JSON, missing fields, invalid data types, and empty arrays. Return meaningful error messages.

tasks.title: Implement Core Algorithm: Snap Endpoints
tasks.description: Snap endpoints within a tolerance to form a wall adjacency graph.
tasks.details: Utilize networkx to create a graph from line segments, snapping endpoints within a specified tolerance to connect walls. Implement pytest unit tests to ensure comprehensive coverage.
tasks.testStrategy: Create pytest unit tests covering: endpoint snapping with various tolerance levels, graph construction correctness, edge cases (overlapping endpoints, isolated segments), and verify graph structure. Include at least 5-7 test cases for good coverage.

subtasks.title: Develop Unit Tests for Endpoint Snapping
subtasks.description: Create pytest unit tests for snapping endpoints with various tolerance levels.
subtasks.details: Ensure tests cover different tolerance values to verify snapping accuracy.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use pytest to validate endpoint snapping across multiple tolerance settings.

subtasks.title: Test Graph Construction Correctness
subtasks.description: Develop tests to ensure the graph is constructed correctly from snapped endpoints.
subtasks.details: Verify that the graph accurately represents the adjacency of walls.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check graph structure and connections using pytest.

subtasks.title: Handle Edge Cases in Graph Construction
subtasks.description: Create tests for edge cases such as overlapping endpoints and isolated segments.
subtasks.details: Ensure edge cases are handled correctly in the graph construction process.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use pytest to test edge cases and verify graph integrity.

subtasks.title: Verify Overall Graph Structure
subtasks.description: Ensure the final graph structure is as expected with all connections intact.
subtasks.details: Check the overall integrity and correctness of the graph structure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct comprehensive tests to validate the final graph structure.

subtasks.title: Implement Endpoint Snapping Algorithm
subtasks.description: Create the algorithm to snap endpoints within tolerance
subtasks.details: Implement logic to find endpoints that are within a specified tolerance distance and group them together for graph construction.

subtasks.title: Create NetworkX Graph Structure
subtasks.description: Build the graph using networkx from snapped endpoints
subtasks.details: Use networkx to create a graph where nodes represent endpoints and edges represent wall segments. Connect nodes based on snapped endpoint groups.

subtasks.title: Implement Tolerance-Based Connection Logic
subtasks.description: Implement the logic to connect walls based on tolerance
subtasks.details: Create a function that determines which wall endpoints should be connected based on distance tolerance, ensuring walls are properly linked in the graph.

subtasks.title: Integrate with Parsed Line Segments
subtasks.description: Connect the snapping algorithm with the parser from task 3
subtasks.details: Ensure the endpoint snapping function accepts the parsed line segment data structure and processes it correctly.

tasks.title: Implement Core Algorithm: Detect Closed Loops
tasks.description: Detect closed loops (cycles) in the wall adjacency graph.
tasks.details: Use networkx to identify cycles in the graph, representing potential room boundaries. Implement pytest unit tests to ensure comprehensive coverage of cycle detection.
tasks.testStrategy: Create pytest unit tests covering: cycle detection in simple and complex graphs, handling of graphs with no cycles, multiple cycles, nested cycles, and verify all closed loops are identified. Include at least 5-7 test cases with good coverage.

subtasks.title: Develop Unit Tests for Cycle Detection
subtasks.description: Create pytest unit tests for cycle detection in various graph scenarios.
subtasks.details: Develop tests for simple graphs, complex graphs, graphs with no cycles, multiple cycles, and nested cycles.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure all test cases are executed and validate the correct identification of closed loops.

subtasks.title: Implement Cycle Detection Algorithm
subtasks.description: Use networkx to detect cycles in the graph
subtasks.details:
Implement a function that uses networkx cycle detection algorithms to find all closed loops in the wall adjacency graph.
<info added on 2025-11-08T21:33:09.616Z>
✅ COMPLETED: Implemented comprehensive face-finding algorithm for multi-room detection.

Implementation details:
- Created `split_lines_at_intersections()` function to split wall segments at all intersection points
- Implemented `find_faces_using_polygonize()` using Shapely's polygonize to find all bounded regions
- Added `find_faces_in_planar_graph()` as fallback using networkx graph-based cycle detection
- Algorithm successfully detects:
  * Simple floorplans: 1 room ✓
  * Multi-room floorplans: 3-4 rooms ✓
  * Complex floorplans with internal walls: All bounded regions ✓

The face-finding algorithm properly handles T-junctions and internal walls, enabling full multi-room detection as required for MVP.
</info added on 2025-11-08T21:33:09.616Z>

subtasks.title: Filter Duplicate Cycles
subtasks.description: Remove duplicate and redundant cycles
subtasks.details: Implement logic to filter out duplicate cycles (same nodes in different order) and ensure each unique cycle is only returned once.

subtasks.title: Structure Cycle Data for Processing
subtasks.description: Format detected cycles for further processing
subtasks.details: Convert networkx cycle data into a structured format (list of node sequences) that can be used by subsequent algorithm steps.

tasks.title: Implement Core Algorithm: Filter Cycles
tasks.description: Filter detected cycles by size and shape to ignore invalid polygons.
tasks.details: Apply filtering criteria to remove small or irregular cycles that do not represent valid rooms. Implement pytest unit tests to ensure the filtering criteria are correctly applied.
tasks.testStrategy: Create pytest unit tests covering: filtering small cycles, filtering irregular shapes, keeping valid room-sized cycles, and edge cases (boundary conditions). Include at least 5-7 test cases for comprehensive coverage.

subtasks.title: Create pytest unit tests for filtering small cycles
subtasks.description: Develop unit tests to ensure small cycles are filtered out correctly.
subtasks.details: Write tests that check if cycles below a certain size threshold are removed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify small cycles are consistently filtered out across different configurations.

subtasks.title: Create pytest unit tests for filtering irregular shapes
subtasks.description: Develop unit tests to ensure irregular shapes are filtered out correctly.
subtasks.details: Write tests that check if cycles with irregular shapes are removed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify irregular shapes are consistently filtered out across different configurations.

subtasks.title: Create pytest unit tests for keeping valid room-sized cycles
subtasks.description: Develop unit tests to ensure valid room-sized cycles are retained.
subtasks.details: Write tests that check if cycles representing valid rooms are kept.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify valid room-sized cycles are consistently retained across different configurations.

subtasks.title: Create pytest unit tests for edge cases
subtasks.description: Develop unit tests to cover edge cases in filtering criteria.
subtasks.details: Write tests for boundary conditions and unusual scenarios.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure edge cases are handled correctly without false positives or negatives.

subtasks.title: Verify filtering criteria with comprehensive test coverage
subtasks.description: Ensure the filtering criteria work correctly with a variety of test cases.
subtasks.details: Review and refine test cases to ensure all aspects of filtering are covered.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure all test cases pass and provide good coverage of the filtering logic.

subtasks.title: Implement Size-Based Filtering
subtasks.description: Filter cycles based on size thresholds
subtasks.details: Implement logic to calculate cycle area/perimeter and filter out cycles that are too small to represent valid rooms (e.g., closets, hall fragments).

subtasks.title: Implement Shape-Based Filtering
subtasks.description: Filter cycles based on shape characteristics
subtasks.details: Implement logic to identify and filter out irregular shapes (e.g., extremely elongated, non-convex) that don't represent typical rooms.

subtasks.title: Define Filtering Criteria and Thresholds
subtasks.description: Establish the filtering parameters
subtasks.details: Define minimum size thresholds, aspect ratio limits, and other criteria for determining valid room cycles. Make these configurable.

subtasks.title: Apply Filters to Detected Cycles
subtasks.description: Apply all filtering criteria to the cycle list
subtasks.details: Create a function that applies size and shape filters to the list of detected cycles, returning only valid room candidates.

tasks.title: Implement Core Algorithm: Convert Polygon to Bounding Box
tasks.description: Convert detected polygons into axis-aligned bounding boxes.
tasks.details: Use shapely to convert polygon cycles into bounding boxes, ensuring they are axis-aligned for simplicity. Implement pytest unit tests to cover bounding box calculation accuracy, axis-aligned conversion, and edge cases such as degenerate polygons and single points.
tasks.testStrategy: Create pytest unit tests to verify bounding boxes accurately encompass the detected polygons. Include at least 5-7 test cases to ensure good coverage, focusing on accuracy, axis alignment, and handling of edge cases.

subtasks.title: Develop Unit Tests for Bounding Box Calculation
subtasks.description: Create pytest unit tests to verify the accuracy of bounding box calculations.
subtasks.details: Ensure tests cover various polygon shapes and sizes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use pytest to validate bounding box dimensions against expected results.

subtasks.title: Test Axis-Aligned Conversion
subtasks.description: Ensure bounding boxes are axis-aligned.
subtasks.details: Test with polygons that have non-axis-aligned edges to confirm conversion.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all bounding boxes are axis-aligned post-conversion.

subtasks.title: Handle Edge Cases
subtasks.description: Test edge cases such as degenerate polygons and single points.
subtasks.details: Include tests for polygons that collapse into lines or points.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure bounding boxes are correctly calculated for edge cases.

subtasks.title: Verify Encompassment of Polygons
subtasks.description: Ensure bounding boxes correctly encompass the original polygons.
subtasks.details: Test with complex polygons to ensure full coverage.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that bounding boxes fully contain the polygons without excess space.

subtasks.title: Implement Polygon to Bounding Box Conversion
subtasks.description: Use shapely to convert cycles to bounding boxes
subtasks.details: Implement a function that takes a cycle (list of nodes) and uses shapely to create a polygon, then extract its axis-aligned bounding box.

subtasks.title: Ensure Axis-Alignment
subtasks.description: Verify bounding boxes are axis-aligned
subtasks.details: Ensure all bounding boxes are axis-aligned (aligned with x and y axes) as required by the MVP specification.

subtasks.title: Calculate Bounding Box Coordinates
subtasks.description: Extract min/max coordinates for each bounding box
subtasks.details: Calculate and return the bounding box coordinates in the format [min_x, min_y, max_x, max_y] for each detected room.

tasks.title: Normalize Bounding Box Coordinates
tasks.description: Normalize bounding box coordinates to a 0–1000 scale.
tasks.details: Scale bounding box coordinates to fit within a 0–1000 coordinate system, maintaining aspect ratio. Implement pytest unit tests to ensure correctness.
tasks.testStrategy: Create pytest unit tests to cover normalization to 0-1000 range, aspect ratio preservation, edge cases (already normalized, extreme coordinates), and verify all coordinates are within bounds. Include at least 5-7 test cases with good coverage.

subtasks.title: Develop Unit Tests for Normalization
subtasks.description: Create pytest unit tests for bounding box normalization.
subtasks.details: Develop tests to ensure bounding boxes are normalized to a 0-1000 range, maintaining aspect ratio.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that bounding boxes are correctly normalized across various test cases, including edge cases.

subtasks.title: Test Aspect Ratio Preservation
subtasks.description: Ensure aspect ratio is preserved during normalization.
subtasks.details: Write tests to confirm aspect ratio is maintained after normalization.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check aspect ratio consistency across different bounding box dimensions.

subtasks.title: Handle Edge Cases
subtasks.description: Test edge cases for bounding box normalization.
subtasks.details: Include tests for already normalized boxes and extreme coordinates.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure edge cases are handled correctly, with coordinates remaining within bounds.

subtasks.title: Implement Normalization Algorithm
subtasks.description: Create the normalization function to scale coordinates
subtasks.details: Implement a function that scales bounding box coordinates to fit within the 0-1000 coordinate system while maintaining the original aspect ratio.

subtasks.title: Preserve Aspect Ratio During Scaling
subtasks.description: Ensure aspect ratio is maintained during normalization
subtasks.details: Calculate the scaling factor that maintains the original aspect ratio while fitting coordinates within the 0-1000 range.

subtasks.title: Ensure Coordinates Within 0-1000 Range
subtasks.description: Validate all coordinates are within bounds
subtasks.details: Add validation to ensure all normalized coordinates fall within the 0-1000 range, handling edge cases like already-normalized or extreme coordinates.

tasks.title: Develop Local Backend API
tasks.description: Create a REST API endpoint for room detection using Express.js or FastAPI. This API will work in conjunction with the UI component in task 11 to display detected room bounding boxes.
tasks.details: Set up a local server with an endpoint that accepts wall-line JSON and returns detected room bounding boxes. This API will enable manual testing through the React UI developed in task 11. Implement integration tests to ensure the API handles various scenarios effectively.
tasks.testStrategy: Use Postman to test API endpoint, ensuring correct input/output handling. Additionally, verify integration with the React UI in task 11 for manual testing. Create integration tests using pytest (for FastAPI) or Jest/Supertest (for Express) to cover: valid JSON acceptance, correct room detection results, invalid input handling, error handling, and response format validation. Include 5-7 integration test cases for comprehensive coverage.

subtasks.title: Set Up API Endpoint
subtasks.description: Develop the API endpoint using Express.js or FastAPI to handle room detection requests.
subtasks.details: Ensure the endpoint accepts wall-line JSON and returns room bounding boxes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use Postman to verify endpoint functionality.

subtasks.title: Create Integration Tests
subtasks.description: Develop integration tests for the API endpoint.
subtasks.details: Use pytest for FastAPI or Jest/Supertest for Express to create tests covering valid JSON acceptance, correct room detection results, invalid input handling, error handling, and response format validation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure tests cover all specified scenarios with 5-7 test cases.

tasks.title: Build React Frontend with Material UI
tasks.description: Set up the React project with Material UI and create a basic UI component to visualize wall line segments from JSON.
tasks.details: Initialize a React project and integrate Material UI. Implement a basic file upload feature for JSON files and create a canvas or SVG component to draw wall line segments based on the JSON data. Include component tests using Jest and React Testing Library for each part.
tasks.testStrategy: Perform manual testing to ensure the React project initializes correctly, Material UI components are styled properly, and the canvas/SVG component accurately visualizes wall line segments from uploaded JSON files. Additionally, implement Jest and React Testing Library tests for each component to ensure functionality and integration.

subtasks.title: Initialize React Project with Material UI
subtasks.description: Set up a new React project and integrate Material UI for styling.
subtasks.details: Use Create React App to initialize the project and add Material UI dependencies.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure the project runs without errors and Material UI components render correctly. Implement Jest and React Testing Library tests to verify Material UI integration.

subtasks.title: Implement JSON File Upload
subtasks.description: Create a component to allow users to upload JSON files containing wall line data.
subtasks.details: Develop a file input component that accepts JSON files and reads their content.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test file upload functionality with sample JSON files to ensure data is read correctly. Include Jest and React Testing Library tests with at least 3-5 test cases to verify component rendering and file handling.

subtasks.title: Create Canvas/SVG Component for Visualization
subtasks.description: Develop a component to draw wall line segments on a canvas or SVG based on JSON input.
subtasks.details: Use HTML5 Canvas or SVG to render lines representing wall segments from the JSON data.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the visual representation matches the data in the JSON files. Implement Jest and React Testing Library tests with at least 3-5 test cases to ensure accurate rendering of wall lines.

tasks.title: Integrate Frontend with Backend API
tasks.description: Create the UI component to display detected room bounding boxes using the React frontend, integrating with the local backend API for room detection. Additionally, implement comprehensive component tests using Jest and React Testing Library.
tasks.details: Use Material UI components to overlay bounding boxes on the blueprint image, display room IDs, and allow basic interaction. This will serve as the main testing interface for the room detection algorithm. Ensure that the UI is robust and handles various user interactions and API responses effectively.
tasks.testStrategy: Test the UI by uploading test data, verifying that bounding boxes are correctly displayed and interactive, and ensuring room IDs are shown accurately. Implement component tests to cover bounding box overlay rendering, room ID display, user interactions (clicking rooms), API integration, error handling, and Material UI component behavior. Include at least 5-7 test cases for comprehensive coverage.

subtasks.title: Create Component Tests
subtasks.description: Develop component tests using Jest and React Testing Library.
subtasks.details: Write tests to cover bounding box overlay rendering, room ID display, user interactions (clicking rooms), API integration, error handling, and Material UI component behavior. Ensure at least 5-7 test cases are implemented.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all test cases pass and cover the specified scenarios effectively.

subtasks.title: Create Bounding Box Overlay Component
subtasks.description: Build React component to overlay bounding boxes on blueprint
subtasks.details: Create a React component that renders bounding boxes as overlays on top of the blueprint image using Material UI components.

subtasks.title: Implement Room ID Display
subtasks.description: Display room IDs on or near each bounding box
subtasks.details: Add text labels showing room IDs (e.g., "room_001") on or near each detected room's bounding box.

subtasks.title: Add Click Interaction Handlers
subtasks.description: Implement click handlers for room selection
subtasks.details: Add event handlers to detect clicks on bounding boxes and provide visual feedback (e.g., highlighting) when a room is selected.

subtasks.title: Integrate API Calls with Error Handling
subtasks.description: Connect frontend to backend API with proper error handling
subtasks.details: Implement API calls to the backend endpoint (from task 9) to fetch room detection results, with proper error handling for network issues and invalid responses.

tasks.title: Implement Observability Features
tasks.description: Add UI elements to display processing metrics such as detection time and confidence score.
tasks.details: Enhance the UI to show metrics like rooms detected, processing time, and confidence score using Material UI components. Ensure integration with React components for real-time updates.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that metrics are accurately displayed and updated in real-time during processing. Implement component tests using Jest and React Testing Library to cover metrics display rendering, real-time updates, Material UI component integration, and accurate calculation and display of metrics.

subtasks.title: Create Jest and React Testing Library tests
subtasks.description: Develop component tests for metrics display rendering, real-time updates, and Material UI integration.
subtasks.details: Include at least 3-5 test cases to ensure good coverage of the observability features.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure tests cover rendering, updates, and integration aspects.

subtasks.title: Create Metrics Display Component
subtasks.description: Build Material UI component to display metrics
subtasks.details: Create a React component using Material UI (e.g., Card, Typography) to display metrics like rooms detected count, processing time, and confidence score.

subtasks.title: Implement Processing Time Calculation
subtasks.description: Calculate and display processing time
subtasks.details: Track the time from when room detection starts until results are received, and display it in a user-friendly format (e.g., "2.34 seconds").

subtasks.title: Implement Confidence Score Calculation
subtasks.description: Calculate confidence score for detections
subtasks.details: Implement logic to calculate a confidence score (0.00-1.00) based on factors like cycle size, shape regularity, and detection quality.

subtasks.title: Add Real-Time Updates
subtasks.description: Update metrics in real-time during processing
subtasks.details: Implement real-time updates to the metrics display as processing progresses, using React state management and potentially WebSocket or polling.

tasks.title: Implement Human-in-the-Loop UX
tasks.description: Allow users to interact with detected rooms, such as highlighting and renaming.
tasks.details: Add functionality for users to click on rooms to highlight them, rename, or remove incorrect detections. Implement React components for these interactions using Material UI.
tasks.testStrategy: Conduct usability testing to ensure interactions are intuitive and responsive. Additionally, implement component tests using Jest and React Testing Library to cover room highlighting on click, room renaming functionality, room removal functionality, user interaction handling, and Material UI component behavior. Include at least 5-7 component test cases with good coverage.

subtasks.title: Test Room Highlighting
subtasks.description: Create a test case for room highlighting on click using Jest and React Testing Library.
subtasks.details: Ensure the room is highlighted correctly when clicked.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the room's visual state changes upon interaction.

subtasks.title: Test Room Renaming
subtasks.description: Create a test case for room renaming functionality using Jest and React Testing Library.
subtasks.details: Ensure the room can be renamed and the change is reflected in the UI.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that the new name is displayed correctly after renaming.

subtasks.title: Test Room Removal
subtasks.description: Create a test case for room removal functionality using Jest and React Testing Library.
subtasks.details: Ensure the room can be removed and the UI updates accordingly.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the room is no longer visible after removal.

subtasks.title: Test User Interaction Handling
subtasks.description: Create a test case for handling user interactions using Jest and React Testing Library.
subtasks.details: Ensure all user interactions are handled smoothly without errors.
subtasks.testStrategy: Simulate user interactions and check for errors or unexpected behavior.

subtasks.title: Test Material UI Component Behavior
subtasks.description: Create a test case for Material UI component behavior using Jest and React Testing Library.
subtasks.details: Ensure Material UI components behave as expected during interactions.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify component behavior aligns with Material UI specifications.

subtasks.title: Implement Room Highlighting on Click
subtasks.description: Add visual highlighting when a room is clicked
subtasks.details: Implement click handlers that change the visual appearance (e.g., border color, background opacity) of a room's bounding box when clicked.

subtasks.title: Implement Room Renaming UI and Logic
subtasks.description: Create UI for renaming rooms with Material UI components
subtasks.details: Add a dialog or inline editing component using Material UI (e.g., TextField, Dialog) that allows users to rename detected rooms.

subtasks.title: Implement Room Removal Functionality
subtasks.description: Add ability to remove incorrect room detections
subtasks.details: Implement a delete/remove button or action that allows users to remove incorrectly detected rooms from the display and results.

subtasks.title: Add Material UI Components for Interactions
subtasks.description: Integrate Material UI components for user interactions
subtasks.details: Use Material UI components (e.g., IconButton, Menu, Dialog) to provide intuitive UI controls for room interactions (highlight, rename, remove).

tasks.title: Create Demo Video
tasks.description: Produce a video demonstrating the workflow and user experience.
tasks.details: Record a video showcasing the process from uploading a blueprint to interacting with detected rooms, highlighting key features and benefits.
tasks.testStrategy: Review video for clarity, completeness, and alignment with product goals.

tasks.title: Prepare README Documentation
tasks.description: Write comprehensive documentation including value story, architecture, and roadmap.
tasks.details: Draft a README file that provides an overview of the project, setup instructions, and future development plans.
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure documentation is clear, accurate, and helpful for new developers.

tasks.title: Conduct Performance Testing
tasks.description: Evaluate system performance against success criteria metrics.
tasks.details: Test the system with various blueprint sizes to measure detection accuracy, false positives, and processing latency.
tasks.testStrategy: Analyze results to confirm compliance with performance targets.

tasks.title: Optimize Core Algorithm for Performance
tasks.description: Enhance the core algorithm to meet latency and accuracy targets.
tasks.details: Refine the algorithm to improve efficiency, possibly exploring parallel processing or algorithmic optimizations.
tasks.testStrategy: Re-test performance metrics post-optimization to ensure improvements.

tasks.title: Prepare for Phase 2 Transition
tasks.description: Plan for the transition to AWS infrastructure post-MVP.
tasks.details: Outline steps for migrating to AWS, including setting up S3, API Gateway, Lambda, and other services.
tasks.testStrategy: Develop a detailed roadmap for Phase 2 implementation, ensuring alignment with MVP learnings.

tasks.title: Create React UI Component for Wall Adjacency Graph Visualization
tasks.description: Develop a React component using Material UI to visualize the wall adjacency graph and highlight detected cycles.
tasks.details: Set up a new React component within the existing project structure. Use Material UI for styling and layout. Implement a canvas or SVG element to render the graph nodes and edges. Integrate with the backend to fetch graph data, including nodes, edges, and detected cycles. Highlight cycles using distinct colors or styles for easy identification. Ensure the component is responsive and can handle dynamic data updates. Provide controls for zooming and panning to navigate large graphs.
tasks.testStrategy: Test the component by integrating it with the backend endpoints from tasks 4 and 5. Use sample data to verify that the graph is rendered correctly and cycles are highlighted. Perform manual testing to ensure the UI is responsive and interactive. Validate that the component updates correctly when new data is received. Additionally, implement automated tests using Jest and React Testing Library to cover graph visualization rendering, cycle highlighting, node and edge display, zoom/pan controls, data updates, and Material UI integration. Include at least 5-7 component test cases with good coverage.

subtasks.title: Set Up React Component Structure
subtasks.description: Create the initial structure for the React component using Material UI.
subtasks.details: Initialize a new React component file within the existing project. Use Material UI components for basic layout.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure the component renders without errors.

subtasks.title: Implement Node and Edge Rendering
subtasks.description: Render graph nodes and edges using canvas or SVG.
subtasks.details: Use a canvas or SVG element to draw nodes and edges. Ensure nodes are positioned correctly and edges connect nodes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify nodes and edges are rendered correctly with sample data.

subtasks.title: Highlight Detected Cycles
subtasks.description: Implement cycle highlighting using distinct colors or styles.
subtasks.details: Identify cycles in the graph data and apply distinct colors or styles to highlight them.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that cycles are highlighted correctly with test data.

subtasks.title: Add Zoom and Pan Controls
subtasks.description: Implement controls for zooming and panning the graph.
subtasks.details: Add interactive controls to allow users to zoom in/out and pan across the graph visualization.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test zoom and pan functionality for smooth interaction.

subtasks.title: Integrate with Backend API
subtasks.description: Fetch graph data from the backend and update the component.
subtasks.details: Connect to the backend API to retrieve nodes, edges, and cycle data. Update the component to reflect dynamic data changes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure data is fetched and rendered correctly by simulating API responses.
